lead_paragraph: STOCKMAN--Henry Charles, Jr. Died peacefully April 21st at "Meadow Ridge" in Redding, CT. He was 97 years old. He was predeceased by his loving wife of 70 years, Jeanne, in July, 2015. The couple lived in Locust Valley and Glen Cove, NY. Henry was born in Englewood, NJ and graduated from the Wharton School in 1939. In WWII, he served in the United States Air Force, where he was a specialist in Japanese and Soviet aircraft. He attained the rank of Lt. Col. and was awarded The Army Commendation Ribbon. He co-authored two books, "Soviet Aircraft" and "Tanks and Armored Vehicles." He was a principal in an employee-benefit consulting firm, Crandon & Stockman, until his retirement in 1987. He served on the board of the Glen Cove Hospital and the Matinecock Zoning Board. Henry and Jeanne raised six children, Helen Stovell, Mina Pell, Jeanne Wullschleger, Henry Stockman III, Robert Stockman and Mimi Wainwright. Their children, 14 grandchildren and 11 great-grandchildren survive them. Henry was a member of the St. Nicholas Society and Piping Rock Club. A private burial is planned on May 12th. In lieu of flowers, the family asks you take a moment to enjoy the melodies of songbirds, one of nature's wonders Henry loved. 1/3
